review: This little device is absolutely fantastic.  Setup was easy, content loads quickly, and it's fairly future-proof (output up to 4k+).  For those thinking about getting it, know that you need another device to tell it what to do (smartphone, tablet, PC, etc.).  However, most of us have one of these devices anyway.  The Chromecast streams Netflix, Pandora, NPR One, YouTube, Chrome browser tabs, and even local content from a PC.  All you have to do is find the right app and you're on your way.For those that want a more simple solution, Roku works, but it doesn't have the potential of this thing.  Programmers are already finding ways to make it work with all of your apps, in addition to making it a full screen SNES ROM emulator.  All this for less than $50.  As a matter of fact, I picked mine up for $23 new.If you're not afraid of pairing two devices, this is a no-brainier.
